Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reviewability of CRA's involuntary GST registration and investigative measures
Crimes.Governing_Law: Federal Court Rules (Rule 302), Excise Tax Act, Federal Courts Act, Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms, Canadian Bill of Rights
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: CRA's Pacesetter RFI considered as separate investigative action
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show grounds for judicial review
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Judicial review limited to specific decisions within jurisdiction; GST assessment challenges belong to Tax Court
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Jurisdictional limits and timeliness of claims
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged constitutional violations and lack of due process
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Federal Courts Act and Excise Tax Act
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: CRA's authority to involuntarily register and investigate
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory provisions and case law on jurisdiction
Crimes.Defendant_Response: CRA argued time-barred claims and lack of jurisdiction
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of CRA actions and relief from enforcement
Crimes.Outcome: Application dismissed with costs to CRA
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Nullification of CRA actions and constitutional relief
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Excise Tax Act, Federal Courts Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal Court lacks jurisdiction over GST assessments

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of CRA's GST enforcement actions
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reviewability of involuntary GST registration and RFI issuance
Crimes.Governing_Law: Federal Court Rules, Excise Tax Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Pacesetter RFI treated as distinct from collection activities
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish reviewable decision
Crimes.Legal_Rule: CRA may assign GST number and assess without voluntary registration; judicial review limited to recent, specific actions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unlawful assessment and violation of rights
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Excise Tax Act, Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: CRA’s authority to assess without registration
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Prior actions not reviewable; current RFI lawful
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and cessation of enforcement
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal Court has limited jurisdiction over RFIs

Crimes.Violation_Type: Misrepresentation or non-disclosure in financial matters
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether tax non-compliance constitutes immigration-related misrepresentation
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Excise Tax Act
Crimes.Application_Facts: CRA assessed individual for unreported GST obligations
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Constitutional issues referred to Tax Court
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application dismissed; only Pacesetter RFI reviewable
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: CRA conducted investigation and issued RFI
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Violation of procedural fairness and Charter rights
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard for judicial review and admissibility of evidence
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature of RFI as investigative vs. enforcement
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Excise Tax Act, IRPA, Canadian Charter
Crimes.Application_Basis: Alleged failure to report income affecting immigration status
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: CRA's investigative steps and registration actions
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of direct link between tax issue and immigration violation
Crimes.Outcome: Dismissed with referral to Tax Court
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential impact on residency or immigration status
Crimes.Cause_Description: Dispute over CRA's assessment and registration practices
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Reviewed for relevance and jurisdictional scope
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Separation between tax enforcement and immigration consequences
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Underlying concern regarding eligibility based on financial compliance
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Failure to disclose income potentially constituting false representation
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court vs. Tax Court division of powers
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Only current RFI reviewable; broader issues require Tax Court
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Scope and admissibility in cross-jurisdictional context
